intro: Morinda corneri, commonly known as the Christmas berry, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright red berries that are typically harvested during the holiday season. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in coastal regions and is often found in sandy soils. The berries are not only ornamental but also have traditional uses in Indigenous Australian cultures.
